label: Select the type of element for certification.

questions_map.label: As part of your product design, is there any specification of security features that is understandable and available to users?
Do you have a documented process for tracking major development decisions or changes applied to the product?
Was functional testing of your product on a defined scope conducted?

Have you implemented controls to detect and prevent potential audit data loss due to imminent audit storage failure.
Is there a cryptographic key management function implemented in your product?

Have you implemented any controls to ensure the security of data while in transit?

Is there an algorithm implemented for a secret generation?

Are there any controls implemented to detect and prevent the use of authentication data that has been forged or copied?

Have you implemented any method that allows authorized administrators to manage security function rules or attributes?
Are there controls implemented that allows authorized administrators to manage the group of roles that can interact with private or sensible data?
Are there controls implemented to allow authorized roles to manage the revocation of accounts?

ICT Web Application

service_category: Basic functional specification and operational user guidance
label: As part of your product design, is there any specification of security features that is understandable and available to users?

answers.label: There is nothing

recommendations.label: It is recommended that product designers distribute their products with all key specifications that describe not only the functional features but also the security features and functionalities.

answers.label: There is a specification and we have invested effort into making it understandable for most users.

label: Do you have a documented process for tracking major development decisions or changes applied to the product?

answers.label: No, there is no process available.

recommendations.label: It is recommended to have a registry or a document where you record major developments and changes applied to your product. The information to be provided can be, for example, an update or modification done to the security features, an update done to the security specification guidance document, product architecture, etc.

answers.label: Yes, there is a documented process for tracking the major development of the product.
N/A

label: Was functional testing of your product on a defined scope conducted?

answers.label: No, there is no functional testing conducted for the product.

recommendations.label: It is a good practice to test and ensure that the designed product  and all the security features  implemented works correctly as intended.

answers.label: functional testing of the product has been conducted.

label: Have you realized a vulnerability assessment of your product in order to identify and address potential vulnerabilities introduced during development or operation?

answers.label: No, there was not any vulnerability assessment conducted for the product.

recommendations.label: Good vulnerability management is key in designing and maintaining a secure product. Hence, it is recommended to run an automatic vulnerability scan of all software modules in the product in order to identify and remediate known vulnerabilities before moving the product to production and on the market.

answers.label: Yes, a vulnerability assessment has been conducted .
A vulnerability assessment has been conducted and all identified vulnerabilities have been remediated.

label: Is there an automatic response process implemented in case a potential security violation is detected?

answers.label: No, there is not any automatic response process implemented to deal with potential security violations.

recommendations.label: It is recommended to have a configurable feature that the user can set to receive security alerts or notifications.

answers.label: An automatic response process has been implemented to deal with defined security violations.

recommendations.label: For certain products, it is recommended to have configurable predefined actions for certain types of incidents or events.

label: Have you defined for each security event alert, a list of data that should be recorded?

answers.label: There is no alert configured for any security event.

recommendations.label: For better management of incidents or security events, it is recommended to have enough information in the audit logs or alerts generated by the product. The alerts generated by the product should at least contain information such as date, time, system or component affected, IP address, etc.

answers.label: A list of data that should be recorded for each security event has been defined.

label: Is it possible to associate each auditable event with the identity of the user that caused the event?

answers.label: Nominative profiles can not be created with our product, hence it is not possible to associate the event with a user?s identity.

recommendations.label: For the purpose of accountability when applicable, it is recommended that audit logs generated by the product can be associated with a profile and user. Also, the administrator profile should have access to the audit logs but should not be able to modify any data in the log.

answers.label: Yes, It is possible to associate a security event with the identity of the user that caused it.
N/A

label: Are there controls implemented to log all types of access to the product?

answers.label: There is no control to log all types of access to the product.

recommendations.label: For the purpose of accountability when applicable, it is recommended that audit logs generated by the product can be associated with a profile and user. Also, the administrator profile should have access to the audit logs but should not be able to modify any data in the log.

answers.label: The product has a log function that logs all types of access to the product.

service_category: Potential violation or attack detection and analysis
label: Are there any controls implemented to identify potential violation based on predefined rule set and known vulnerabilities ?

answers.label: No, there is no control implemented to identify potential violation based on predefined rule set.

recommendations.label: When applicable, it is recommended to have configurable features for administrators to set rules for the identification of security violations and incidents.

answers.label: A number of rule sets have been implemented and are capable to flag any potential violation.
N/A

label: Is it possible for users of your product to access and read information from the audit records?

answers.label: Audit records is accessible to all users of the product, there is no control restrict access to only authorised users.

recommendations.label: The access control on your product should be very explicit and denied by default. Access to audit logs should be limited to administrators and authorized users only. No user or even administrator should not have the capacity to modify or delete an audit log.

answers.label: There are controls implemented to limit access to audit record to only authorized users.
There are not any audit data recorded.

label: Have you implemented controls to prevent any modification or deletion of the audit trail?

answers.label: Audit trails or records ar modifiable by any user profile.

recommendations.label: Audit logs are key for accountability and forensic investigation. Hence, it is recommended to implement controls and prevent any user, even administrator from modifying and deleting information generated in the audit trail.

answers.label: Only authorized administrators can edit or modify an audit trail.

recommendations.label: Audit logs are key for accountability and forensic investigation. Hence, it is recommended to implement controls and prevent any user, even administrator from modifying and deleting information generated in the audit trail.

answers.label: Audit trail cannot be modified or delited by any user profile.

label: Are there controls implemented to monitor the audit storage capability and ensure audit data availability?

answers.label: No, there is no control implemented to monitor audit storage capability.

recommendations.label: As there is no infinite storage capacity available on the products, it is recommended to have functionalities that allow administrators to monitor and manage audit storage capacity.

answers.label: The product has controls implemented to ensure that any potential issues the storage capability is proactively detected in advance.

label: Have you implemented controls to detect and prevent potential audit data loss due to imminent audit storage failure.

answers.label: There is no control implemented to detect any potential incident with the audit storage.

recommendations.label: It also recommended having a configurable feature that can detect and alert the administrator or the user on potential audit storage failure.

answers.label: There are controls implemented to ensure that potential audit storage incident or failure is proactively detected and resolved.

label: Is there a cryptographic key management function implemented in your product?

answers.label: There is no cryptographic key management function implemented.

recommendations.label: Cryptographic keys must be managed throughout their life cycle. Hence, it is recommended when applicable to implement controls to ensure secure key generation, key distribution, key access, and key destruction.

answers.label: Cryptographic key generation function is implemented.

recommendations.label: Cryptographic key generation should be done in accordance with a specified algorithm and key sizes which can be based on an assigned standard.

answers.label: Cryptographic key distribution function is implemented.

recommendations.label: Cryptographic key distribution should be distributed in accordance with a specified distribution method which can be based on an assigned standard.

answers.label: Cryptographic key access function is implemented.

recommendations.label: Cryptographic key access should be performed in accordance with a specified access method which can be based on an assigned standard.

answers.label: Cryptographic key destruction function is implemented.

recommendations.label: Cryptographic key destruction should be done in accordance with a specified destruction method which can be based on an assigned standard.

answers.label: N/A

service_category: Stored data integrity monitoring and action
label: Are there controls implemented to guarantee the security of data stored or processed by your product?

answers.label: There is no security control implemented to ensure data security at rest or when being used for certain operations.

recommendations.label: Data privacy is crucial for the survival of your product and even your company in today's market. Hence, it is recommended to implement controls to ensure the security of users' data when it is processed or stored by your product. Encryption or anonymization could be an example of security control.

answers.label: There are controls implemented to ensure the security of data stored or processed by the product.

section: Inter-TSF user data confidentiality transfer protection (FDP_UCT)
label: Have you implemented any controls to ensure the security of data while in transit?

answers.label: There is no security control implemented to ensure data security while in transit.

recommendations.label: Data privacy is crucial for the survival of your product and even your company in today's market. Hence, it is recommended to implement controls to ensure the security of users' data when it is processed or stored by your product. Encryption or anonymization could be an example of security control.

answers.label: There are controls implemented to ensure the security of data in transit.

section: Inter-TSF user data integrity transfer protection (FDP_UIT)
label: Is your product able to recover from a list of known recoverable errors?

answers.label: No, there is not any automatic recovery mechanism implemented.

recommendations.label: Being able to recover from incidents or security events is key in maintaining the operational continuity of a product. Hence, the product should have configurable parameters and/or implemented controls for recovery point objectives for defined security events.

answers.label: Yes, automatic recovery mechanisms from known incidents and events are implemented.
N/A

label: Are controls implemented to manage a threshold of unsuccessful authentification attempts?

answers.label: The number of unsuccessful authentification attempts is not tracked.

recommendations.label: Efficient access management controls are key to ensuring the security of all products. It is therefore recommended to define a threshold of possible unsuccessful authentification attempts. Passing this threshold the product should automatically lock the user account and inform the user via a provided communication medium (email or text message).

answers.label: The user account is permanently or temporarily locked after a defined number of unsuccessful authentification attempts.
The user is informed via email or text message after a defined number of unsuccessful authentification attempts.

label: Are users of the product have a set of security attributes, other than the user?s identity?

answers.label: No, users do not have any security attribute, other than their identity.

recommendations.label: It is important to define all possible user security attributes, other than the user?s identity for better access management. These attributes can be profiles, roles, accounts, rights revocation, etc.

answers.label: In addition to their identity, users do have other security attributes.
N/A

label: Is there a secret verification method implemented?

answers.label: There is no secret verification method implemented.

recommendations.label: The secret verification mechanism implemented in the product must not have any exploitable vulnerability. Hence, it is recommended to test and verify that the secret verification method implemented does not have any vulnerability. For example product secret information (PIN, Password, etc.) should not be stored in plain text on the product.

answers.label: There is a secret verification method implemented, however, we do not know if it is secure.
The secret verification method implemented, has been tested and any identified vulnerabilities have been remediated.

label: Is there an algorithm implemented for a secret generation?

answers.label: The algorithm implemented for secrets generation has a known flaw.

recommendations.label: As part of the security of the product is based on the secret data generated, we recommend using a secure secret generation algorithm and possibly evaluating and testing the security of the implementation of the algorithm.

answers.label: We have implemented a proprietary secret generation algorithm.
A secure secret generation algorithm has been implemented.
N/A

label: Have you implemented an access control mechanism that requires users to authenticate before any other action is allowed?

answers.label: Users can perform certain actions without being authenticated.

recommendations.label: Authentication is the fundamental security control, hence when applicable, It is recommended to establish an authentication mechanism based on the user's "Username" and "Password" or "PIN".

answers.label: Users do not need to authenticate, in order to do any action  with the product.
Users can only perform any given action or activity if only they are authenticated and authorized.
N/A

label: Are there any controls implemented to detect and prevent the use of authentication data that has been forged or copied?

answers.label: No, there is no control implemented to detect and prevent the use of authentication data that has been forged or copied.

recommendations.label: Secure authentication mechanism is key in ensuring security. Hence, controls should be implemented to detect potential fraudulent authentication data. For example, the product should be able to detect expired session cookies and deny access when it is used for authentication.

answers.label: Yes, controls have been implemented to detect and prevent the use of authentication data that has been forged or copied.

label: Have you implemented any function that allows authorized administrators to manage subject security attributes?

answers.label: There is no function that allows authorized administrators to manage subject security attributes.

recommendations.label: Security attributes are an important part of a product. Administrators being able to grant or retrieve access rights is an example of ensuring security through access management. It is, therefore, a good practice to evaluate and define all possible security attributes of your product based on functional and operational requirements during the design phase.

answers.label: Administrators are able to manage subjects? security attributes.

recommendations.label: It is also crucial to limit the management of these security attributes only to administrators' profiles. Any other profiles should not have the means or capacity to manage any of the security attributes.

answers.label: N/A

service_category: Management of security functions and attributes
label: Have you implemented any method that allows authorized administrators to manage security function rules or attributes?

answers.label: There is no method implemented to allow authorized administrators to manage security function rules or attributes.

recommendations.label: Security attributes are an important part of a product. Administrators being able to grant or retrieve access rights is an example of ensuring security through access management. It is, therefore, a good practice to evaluate and define all possible security attributes of your product based on functional and operational requirements during the design phase.

answers.label: There are methods implemented to allow authorized administrators to manage security function rules or attributes.

recommendations.label: It is also crucial to limit the management of these security attributes only to administrators' profiles. Any other profiles should not have the means or capacity to manage any of the security attributes.

service_category: FMT_MTD.2 Management of limits on TSF data
label: Are there controls implemented that allows authorized administrators to manage the group of roles that can interact with private or sensible data?

answers.label: All users can access all data stored or processed by the product.

recommendations.label: To ensure data privacy, it is key to have access management controls implemented. Hence, it is crucial to implement features and user profiles that can allow administrators to grant access to data based on the need-to-know principle.

answers.label: Access to data can be granted based on the profile of the user and the rights given by the administrators.

label: Are there controls implemented to allow authorized roles to manage the revocation of accounts?

answers.label: Only users can decide to delete their account or profile.

recommendations.label: Users' account management should only be reserved for an administrator's profile. Any other profile should not have the required rights and means to create, modify or revocate users' accounts.

answers.label: All users are able to revocate any accounts.
Only administrators are able to revoke users' accounts.

section: Data Anonymity , Pseudonymity, unlinkability, unobservability solutions
service_category: Data Anonymity , Pseudonymity, unlinkability, unobservability solutions
label: Is there any controls or mechanism implemented to ensure  anonymity when required?

answers.label: There is no control implemented to ensure  anonymity.

recommendations.label: If data anonymity is required for your product or business model, it is recommended to not collect Personal Identifiable Information in the first place. Only collect information that is necessary for your product to work and active its objectives.

answers.label: Data privacy controls are considered and implemented.
Data anonymity feature is available and could be activated by an administrator.
There are controls implemented that allow only authorized users to access data, in order to ensure confidentiality.

service_category: Failure with preservation of secure state
label: Are there controls implemented to ensure that the product preserves a secure state in case of failure?

answers.label: There is no control implemented to ensure that the product preserves a secure state in case of failure.

It is there recommended to implement controls that safeguard the security state of the product in case of failure. It is crucial to evaluate and confirm that the controls implemented work effectively.

answers.label: There is no test conducted to verify if the product preserves a secure state in case of failure.
Our product has been tested and the results show that it preserves a secure state in case of failure.

label: Are there controls implemented to ensure that any possible modification to data during transmission is detected and remediated accordantly?

recommendations.label: When there are considerable risks of data during transfer either between components or products, it is highly recommended to implement security controls. Based on the processing capacity/power of your product, encryption of data during transfer should be done.

answers.label: Controls are implemented to detect, notify any potential modification to data during transmission.

recommendations.label: When there are considerable risks of data during transfer either between components or products, it is highly recommended to implement security controls. Based on the processing capacity/power of your product, encryption of data during transfer should be done.

answers.label: Our product has been tested, and it is resilient to any potential physical security attack.

answers.label: There is no reset or manual recovery mechanism implemented to ensure a return to a secure state when needed.

recommendations.label: It is normal that a product has malfunction issues, however, it is recommended to provide users with the features or methods to reset the product to a know secure state.

answers.label: There is a manual recovery mechanism implemented to ensure a return to a secure state when needed.

label: Are controls implemented to detect and prevent any potential replay attacks?

answers.label: No, there is no control implemented to detect potential replay attacks.

recommendations.label: Another important recommendation on session management, is to have a configurable that can be set to automaticaly locked or terminate open sessions after a defined period period of user inactivity.

recommendations.label: Another important recommendation on session management, is to have a configurable that can be set to automatically locked or terminate open sessions after a defined period period of user inactivity.

answers.label: No, there is no configurable banner service available.
